div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION
In the Matter of the Application of YO YOU JAM for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.} No. 3395 RETURN

TO THE HONORABLE JEREMIAH NETERER, JUDGE OF THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON: Now comes the respondent, Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration at the port of Seattle, and for answer to the writ of habeas corpus herein, says that he here produces the body of Yo You Jam the person named in the petition for said writ, in obedience to the command and direction thereof, and for further return and answer to said writ, here avers that he detained in his custody the body of the said Yo You Jam for deportation from the United States, as an alien and Chinese person not entitled to admission under the laws of the United States, under and by virtue of an order of the Secretary of Labor of the United States issued to him, said respondent, on July 24, 1916, which said order is in the words and figures following, that is to say:

"54085/118 July 24, 1916. Commissioner of Immigration, Seattle , Washington referring to your leter of the 20th ultimo, No. 33848, addresses to the Chinese Inspector in Charge, transmitting the record on appeal in the case of Yo You Jam, you are advised that after carefully considering the evidence presented in the record, the Secretary has affirmed your excluding decision and ordered the deportation of this Chinese.
Your exhibits in this case are returned herewith. For the Commissioner- General A. Warner Parker Law Officer.

Respondent attaches hereto the complete record, decision, and exhibits in said matter, both in the hearing before said Commissioner and on appeal to the Secretary of Labor, which constitutes a part of this return.
And now the respondent having fully answered, prays that the said writ may be discahrged, and that he may be awarded his costs about his return to the writ aforesaid in this behalf expended.
Henry M. White Commissioner of Immigration.
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.} ss.

Henry M. White, being first duly sworn, upon his oath deposes and says: That he is the Commissioner of Immigration named in the foregoing return; that he has read the said return, knows the contents thereof and beleives the same to be true.

Henry M. White Subscribed and sworn to before me this 13th day of September, 1916. EdM Lakin Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle. Deputy Clerk, U.S. District Court Western District of Washington
